private_information: I can move vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I, O
I can only move blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks to the specified target tower ordering with O on the table.

private_information: I can move consonant-labeled blocks: L, H, J, N, G, B, D, K, F, C, M
I can only move blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks to the specified target tower ordering with O on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that achieves the global target tower ordering using the two agents' capabilities.

public_information: There are blocks labeled: I, L, H, J, N, G, B, D, A, K, F, E, C, M, O.

Initial stacking: I is on the table, L is on top of I, H is on the table, J is on top of L, N is on top of H, G is on top of J, B is on top of G, D is on top of B, A is on top of D, K is on top of N, F is on top of K, E is on top of F, C is on top of A, M is on top of C, O is on top of M.
Only the top block of each stack can be picked up and moved, and agents move one block at a time.
One agent can move only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I, O, U), the other can move only consonant-labeled blocks.
The table can hold multiple stacks and blocks placed directly on the table are considered on a 'table' location.

describe.system_prompt: You are an observing and acting agent restricted to vowel-labeled blocks. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise structured description of: which vowel blocks exist in the environment, which of those are currently at the top of a stack, any local constraints you detect, and the exact actions you are capable of performing (pick and place operations limited to top-of-stack and one block at a time).
describe.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Provide a clear structured observation and capability report about vowel blocks only. Do not output PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are an observing and acting agent restricted to consonant-labeled blocks. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise structured description of: which consonant blocks exist in the environment, which of those are currently at the top of a stack, any local constraints you detect, and the exact actions you are capable of performing (pick and place operations limited to top-of-stack and one block at a time).
describe.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Provide a clear structured observation and capability report about consonant blocks only. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning. Your job is to integrate the agents' observations and capabilities and produce a single complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Keep the agents' actions distinct in the domain (e.g., separate action names or agent predicates), model the top-of-stack restriction and single-block moves, and include typing or predicates compatible with FastDownward. If some information is partial in the observations, make explicit any assumptions you make in comments inside the PDDL files.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Global public information: {environment->public_information} Observations from vowel agent: {obs_vowel} Observations from consonant agent: {obs_consonant} Your task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the inputs and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that implement the agents' abilities and achieve the specified goal. Enclose the domain in <domain> tags and the problem in <problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver.
